title: Stefano Palatchi
text:
Stefano Palatchi Ribera (born 26 March 1960), known publicly as Stefano Palatchi, is a Spanish <a href="opera">opera</a> singer who has sung leading <a href="Bass%20%28vocal%20range%29">bass</a> roles in Spain and internationally and is noted for stage skills, timbre. and expressiveness. His concert repertoire includes <a href="Requiem%20%28Mozart%29">Mozart's "Requiem"</a> and <a href="Requiem%20%28Verdi%29">Verdi's "Messa da Requiem"</a> which he has sung many times.
Biography.
Background.
Palatchi was born in <a href="Barcelona">Barcelona</a>.
His mother had studied under <a href="Conchita%20Bad%C3%ADa">Conchita Badía</a>, teacher of <a href="Montserrat%20Caballe">Montserrat Caballe</a>. Palatchi himself had started to study singing at age 15 under <a href="Maya%20Maiska">Maya Maiska</a>. He began singing "<a href="zarzuela">zarzuela</a>" and then opera: Un día, mientras estaba tomando clase con el maestro Puig, llegó <a href="Luis%20Andreu%20Marf%C3%A0">Luis Andreu Marfà</a>, entonces director artístico del <a href="Liceu">Liceo</a>, y me oyó cantar. Le gusté y me propuso interpretar un pequeño papel en "Lohengrin" de Wagner. Ese fue mi debut.<br><br>One day, as I was taking class with my teacher Puig, in came <a href="Luis%20Andreu%20Marf%C3%A0">Luis Andreu Marfà</a>, then artistic director of the <a href="Liceu">Liceu</a>, and he heard me sing. He liked me and proposed that I play a small role in <a href="Richard%20Wagner">Wagner</a>'s "<a href="Lohengrin%20%28opera%29">Lohengrin</a>". That was my debut. He went on to study under <a href="Gino%20Bechi">Gino Bechi</a>, <a href="Ettore%20Campogalliani">Ettore Campogalliani</a>, and <a href="Armen%20Boyajian">Armen Boyajian</a>, with further studies in Florence and New York.
Career.
Palatchi debuted in the <a href="Gran%20Teatre%20del%20Liceu">Gran Teatre del Liceu</a> in Barcelona, in 1986. He also performed in "<a href="Turandot">Turandot</a>", when the Liceu was reopened in 1999, following the fire which had destroyed the theatre five years earlier.
He has taken part in several hundred performances of more than thirty operas from a wide repertoire, in particular operas by <a href="Giuseppe%20Verdi">Giuseppe Verdi</a> and <a href="Giacomo%20Puccini">Giacomo Puccini</a>, and those from the bel canto repertoire including: "<a href="Rigoletto">Rigoletto</a>", "<a href="Aida">Aida</a>", "<a href="Turandot">Turandot</a>", "<a href="Il%20trovatore">Il trovatore</a>", "<a href="La%20boh%C3%A8me">La bohème</a>", "<a href="Macbeth%20%28opera%29">Macbeth</a>", "<a href="Lucia%20di%20Lammermoor">Lucia di Lammermoor</a>", "<a href="La%20forza%20del%20destino">La forza del destino</a>" and "<a href="Il%20barbiere%20di%20Siviglia">Il barbiere di Siviglia</a>", "<a href="Samson%20et%20Dalila">Samson et Dalila</a>", and "<a href="Tha%C3%AFs%20%28opera%29">Thaïs</a>".
He has sung in world premières of "Cristóbal Colón", by <a href="Leonardo%20Balada">Leonardo Balada</a> (with <a href="Montserrat%20Caball%C3%A9">Montserrat Caballé</a> and <a href="Jos%C3%A9%20Carreras">José Carreras</a>), "Gaudí", by <a href="Joan%20Guinjoan">Joan Guinjoan</a> and "Joc de Mans" by Alberto García Detesters. In 2009, he partook in the Spanish premiere of <a href="Crist%C3%B3bal%20Halffter">Cristóbal Halffter</a>'s opera, "Lazaro", and "Tales of Hoffman"
Palatchi has sung in theaters and festivals outside of Spain, including New York's <a href="Metropolitan%20Opera">Metropolitan Opera</a>, where he made his debut in 1994 as Colline in "<a href="La%20boh%C3%A8me">La bohème</a>".
Activities.
Palatchi supports the Clarós Foundation dedicated to the prevention of and research into acute deafness. As part of his support, he recites to raise funds for the charity.

Discography.
Palatchi has recorded for <a href="Decca%20Records">Decca</a>, RTVE Música, Columna Música, Nightingale Classics, Koch Discover, Astrée Auvidis, Auvidis, Auvidis Valois, Sello Autor, <a href="Naxos%20Records">Naxos</a> and Opus Arte.
Repertoire.
He has expanded his repertoire into Jazz (2012), Russian Folk, and Swing (2014), the last of which has earned him the epithet "Crooner" in Spain.
Awards.
In 2000, Palatchi received a <a href="Latin%20Grammy%20Award">Latin Grammy Award</a> for <a href="Tom%C3%A1s%20Bret%C3%B3n">Tomás Bretón</a>'s <a href="zarzuela">zarzuela</a>, "<a href="La%20Dolores">La Dolores</a>".
He was nominated for another <a href="Latin%20Grammy%20for%20Best%20Classical%20Album">Latin Grammy</a> for <a href="Ruperto%20Chap%C3%AD">Ruperto Chapí</a>'s "Margarita la Tornera" (2003) and a <a href="Grammy%20Award">Grammy Award</a> for "El gato con botas", by <a href="Xavier%20Montsalvatge">Xavier Montsalvatge</a>.
